file.name: captcha.yaml
file.content:
# Copyright 2021, Andrew Lindesay
# Distributed under the terms of the MIT License.

openapi: 3.0.3
info:
  title: HDS Captcha API
  version: "2.0"
  description: >
    This API is to do with captchas.  A captcha is a small image that is shown to a user in order for the user to
    supply some textual response from the image in order to verify that the operator is likely to be human and not a
    computer.  This helps to prevent machine-hacking of systems.  This API is able to provide a captcha and other
    APIs require that a 'captcha response' is supplied as part of a request.  In general a captcha is valid for a
    certain length of time.
tags:
  - name: captcha
paths:
  /__api/v2/captcha/generate-captcha:
    description: >
      This method will return a captcha that can be used in systems where a captcha response (generated by a
      human) is required to be supplied with an API request.
    post:
      tags:
        - captcha
      operationId: generateCaptcha
      requestBody:
        required: true
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/generateCaptureRequestEnvelope"
      responses:
        200:
          description: >
            The generated captcha data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/generateCaptureResponseEnvelope"

components:
  schemas:
    generateCaptureRequestEnvelope:
      type: object
    generateCaptureResponseEnvelope:
      type: object
      properties:
        result:
          $ref: "#/components/schemas/generateCaptchaResult"
        error:
          $ref: "./error.yaml#/components/schemas/error"
    generateCaptchaResult:
      type: object
      properties:
        token:
          type: string
          description: >
            This token uniquely identifies the captcha.
        pngImageDataBase64:
          type: string
          description: >
            This is a base-64 encoded image of the captcha.  It could, for example, be used with
            a data url to render the image in an "img" tag on a web page.

Error: parse: parse spec: parse components: schemas: "generateCaptureResponseEnvelope": parse schema: property "error": parse schema: resolve "./error.yaml#/components/schemas/error": external "./error.yaml": file: local file reference is not allowed
